For example, a value of `[3600, 86400, 432000]` indicates that notifications will be sent 1 hour, 24 hours, and 5 days after a checkout is abandoned. The number of notifications (items in array) must be between 1 and 3.

status.description:
The status of the bulk action. Possible values include:
- `completed`: The bulk action has been executed, possibly with some errors.
- `invalid`: The bulk action contains no record_ids that support the given action.
- `pending`: The bulk action is pending and not yet processed.
- `processing`: The bulk action is currently being processed.
- `succeeded`: The bulk action has succeeded with no errors for all the supporting record_ids.

inherit_customer_enabled.description:
Each order has a series of attributes `inherited_billing_address`, `inherited_shipping_address`, `inherited_tax_identifier`, `inherited_name`, `inherited_phone`, and `inherited_email`.
If this is enabled, the order will inherit these attributes from the customer when they are not present on the associated checkout.
This allows changes to a customers details to be reflected on past orders and statements.

line_item.description: The UUID of the line item.

note.description: A note to capture extra details about this return item. This is required when the return reason is `other`.

return_reason.description: The reason for returning the item â€“ one of `color`, `defective`, `not_as_described`, `other`, `size_too_large`, `size_too_small`, `style`, `unknown`, `unwanted`, or `wrong_item`. The list of these reasons can be fetched from the `/return_reasons` endpoint.

quantity.description: The quantity of products being returned. This must be less than or equal to the fulfilled quantity of the associated line item.

line_item.description: The UUID of the line item.

return_reason_description.description: The full description of the return reason.

return_items.description: A list of this return request's items.

number.description: The unique identifier for this return request that is auto generated based on this account's order protocol.

return_items.description: A list of associated return items.

status.description: The current status of this return request â€“ either `open` or `complete`.

stars.description: The numerical rating provided in the review. Can be a decimal from 1.0 to 5.0.

customer.description: The UUID of the customer who wrote the review.

product.description: The UUID of the product being reviewed.

purchase.description: The UUID of the purchase of product.

verified.description: Indicates whether the reviewer has purchased the product (based on presence of a purchase).

customer.description: The customer who wrote the review.

review_medias.description: A list of associated review medias.

alt.description: The HTML alt attribute for the review media.

title.description: The HTML title attribute for the review media.

url.description: Instead of attaching a `Media` record, a public URL can be set. If set, this URL will be used to serve the review media asset.

reviews_enabled.description: If set to `true`, reviews will be enabled globally for all products in the account. Individual products must also have reviews enabled for reviews to be shown.

solicit_reviews.description: If set to `true`, review solicitation emails will be sent to customers who have purchased products. Individual products must also have solicitation enabled.

solicit_reviews_after_days.description: The number of days after an order is fulfilled that a review solicitation email will be sent to the customer.

key.description: The attribute key that can be used in rule conditions (e.g., `subtotal_amount`, `customer.created_at`).

metadata.description: Whether this attribute represents a metadata field.

supported_values.description: A list of allowed values that can be used for comparison. Empty array if no specific values are enforced.

type.description: The data type of the attribute. One of `numeric`, `string`, or `date`.

operators.description: The list of comparison operators available for this attribute (e.g., `is`, `is_not`, `is_more_than`).

object.description: A string describing the object type returned.

schema_id.description: The unique identifier for this rule schema (e.g., `auto_fee__checkout`, `auto_fee__line_item`).

attributes.description: The list of attributes available for building rule conditions.

object.description: A string describing the object type returned.

limit.description: The number of items per page. The default is `20` and the maximum is `100`.

deleted.description: Whether or not this object was succesfully deleted.

id.description: The UUID of the specific object.

object.description: A string describing the object type returned.

metadata.description: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

created_at.description: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

updated_at.description: Time at which the object was last updated. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

discarded_at.description: Time at which the object was discarded. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

object.description: A string describing the object type returned.

currency.description: The end of the date range for the query.

end_at.description: The end of the date range for the query.

interval.description: The interval that is set for the query.

start_at.description: The start of the date range for the query.

object.description: A string describing the object type returned.

amount.description: The amount in cents to be added or subtracted, represented as an integer. For example `9900` is equivalent to `$99`.

description.description: A short description of the shipping fee.

fee_type.description: The type of shipping_fee â€“ one of `auto` or `manual`.

name.description: A name for this shipping method that will be visible to customers.

description.description: A short description for this shipping method that will be visible to customers.

shipping_rates.description: A list of associated shipping rates.

name.description: A name for this shipping profile that will be visible to customers.

fallback_shipping_zone.description: The UUID of the shipping zone that should be the fallback when a specific shipping zone does not match the checkout's shipping address. This is commonly referred to as a "Rest of World" shipping zone.

default.description: Whether or not this shipping profile is the default for the account.

shipping_zones.description: A list of associated shipping zones.

shipping_enabled.description: If set to `true` a shipping choice will be required for checkouts that have `shipping_enabled` products.

amount.description: The amount in cents to be charged, represented as a whole integer. For example `9900` is equivalent to `$99`.

rate_type.description: The calculation strategy for this shipping rate â€“ one of `amount`, `flat`, or `weight`. If `amount`, this shipping rate will be applicable to checkouts that have a `subtotal_amount` within the min/max amount range. If `flat`, this rate will be applicable to all line items. If `weight`, this rate will be applicable to line items that have a combined weight within the min/max weight range.

min_amount.description: The minimum `subtotal_amount` of a checkout for this rate to apply.

max_amount.description: The maximum `subtotal_amount` of a checkout for this rate to apply.

min_weight.description: The minimum combined `weight` of a line item for this rate to apply.

max_weight.description: The maximum combined `weight` of a line item for this rate to apply.

weight_unit.description: The weight unit for this shipping rate â€“ one of `lb`, `oz`, `kg`, `g`.

shipping_zone.description: The UUID of the shipping zone.

shipping_method.description: The UUID of the shipping method.

currency.description: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. This value will match the `Account` currency.

name.description: A name for this shipping zone that will be visible to customers.

territories.description: The specific territories that this shipping zone covers.

country.description: The country associated with the territory.

states.description: List of states within the country.

shipping_profile.description: The UUID of the shipping profile.

shipping_rates.description: A list of associated shipping rates.

ad_hoc_amount.description: The amount to use for this subscription when the associated price is `ad_hoc=true`.

affiliation_expires_at.description: Time at which the affiliation will expire.

cancel_at_period_end.description: If the subscription is set to cancel at the end of the current period. You can use this attribute to determine whether a subscription that has a `status` of `active` is scheduled to be canceled at the end of the current period.

live_mode.description: Set to `true` if this subscription is in live mode, and set to `false` if it is in test mode.

manual_payment.description: Whether or not this subscription should finalize checkouts during renewal with the `manual_payment=true` option.

quantity.description: The quantity of products being purchased.

restore_at.description: The time at which this subscription will automatically be restored. This can only be set if the subscription is canceled or set to cancel at period end.

restart_on_completed.description: Whether installment subscriptions should be automatically restarted when they reach the completed state. When the subscription is created, this value will be inherited from the price `restart_subscription_on_completed` value.

tax_enabled.description: Whether or not tax is enabled for this subscription. This will default to the account's `tax_protocol.tax_enabled` value when the subscription is created.

trial_end_at.description: If the subscription has a trial, the end of that trial.

affiliation.description: The affiliation associated with this subscription.

currency.description: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. This value will match the `Account` currency.

discount.description: The parameters of the discount to be applied to this subscription.

imported.description: Whether or not this subscription is being imported from another platform. If `true`, the `first_sc_period_start_at` value must be set.

manual_payment_method.description: The UUID of the manual payment method.

first_sc_period_start_at.description: The time at which the next period should start for this subscription. This value should be set when importing subscriptions to maintain the billing cycle. (This value is only applicable during subscription creation.)

payment_method.description: The UUID of the payment method.

purge_pending_update.description: When set to `true` the `pending_update` will be cleared.

shipping_method.description: The UUID of the shipping method.

restore_at.description: The time at which this subscription will automatically be restored. This can only be set if the subscription is canceled or set to cancel at period end.

current_period_end_at.description: End of the current period that the subscription is in. At the end of this period, a new period will be created. This will be `null` when the subscription has a one-time price.

current_period_start_at.description: Start of the current period that the subscription is in.

ended_at.description: If the subscription has ended, the date the subscription ended.

finite.description: Whether or not this subscription belongs to a price with a set `recurring_period_count`, meaning it has a defined end.

last_renewal_reminder_sent_at.description: Time at which the last renewal reminder notification sent. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

price.description: The UUID of the price this subscription will be updated to at the end of the current period.

quantity.description: The quantity of products being purchased at the end of the current period.

portal_url.description: A URL that will redirect to this subscription's correct portal page (hosted or external).

price_readonly.description: Whether or not the price of this subscription can be modified. If `true`, the price is locked and cannot be changed

remaining_period_count.description: The number of periods remaining before this subscription ends. This count is reduced when a period is paid.

subtotal_amount.description: Total of the subscription before discounts or taxes are applied.

status.description: The current status of this subscription, which can be one of `incomplete`, `trialing`, `active`, `past_due`, `canceled`, or `completed`.

affiliation.description: The affiliation associated with this subscription.

variant_options.description: An array of the associated variant's options.

bypass_duplicate_trials.description: Whether or not to skip the trial period for a product if the customer has already been in a trial.

cancel_behavior.description: Controls how subscription cancellations should be handled â€“ one of `immediate` or `pending`.

cancel_window_enabled.description: Whether or not the subscription cancel window is enabled.

cancel_window_days.description: The number of days prior to a subscription renewing that the cancel option will be visible to customers.

default_payment_method_detach_enabled.description: Whether or not default payment methods can be removed.

default_payment_method_fallback_enabled.description: Whether or not the customer's default payment method should be used as a fallback when a subscription does not have a payment method.

downgrade_behavior.description: Controls how subscription changes should be handled when downgrading â€“ one of `immediate` or `pending`.

payment_retry_window_weeks.description: The number of weeks to retry failed subscription payments before canceling the subscription.

preservation_enabled.description: Whether or not subscription preservation is enabled.

preservation_locales.description: A collection of locale strings that will be used when displaying the subscription preservation flow to customers. These strings have access to the following liquid variables: `amount` and `name`.

remind_at_period_percent_remaining.description: Specifies the percentage of time remaining in the subscription period at which a reminder should be sent. For example, if set to 25%, the reminder will be triggered when there is 25% of the subscription period remaining.

remind_after_days.description: Specifies the minimum number of days that must pass since the last reminder (or subscription creation if no reminder has been sent) before a new reminder can be sent. For example, if set to 180, a reminder will only be sent if at least 180 days have passed since the last reminder. This prevents reminders from being sent too frequently across multiple subscription periods.

require_upfront_payment_method.description: Whether or not a payment method should be required for subscriptions that have an initial period amount of $0 (free trial or coupon).

revoke_purchases_on_past_due.description: Whether or not a purchase should be revoked when a subscription becomes past_due. If the subscription transitions to the `active` or `trialing` state the associated purchase will be automatically invoked again.

upgrade_behavior.description: Controls how subscription changes should be handled when upgrading â€“ one of `immediate` or `pending`.

preservation_coupon.description: The associated coupon that is applied to subscriptions when a cancellation reason with `coupon_enabled=true` is selected and the susbcription is preserved.

archived.description: Whether or not this swap is archived.

description.description: A description of this swap. This text will be visibile to customers in the checkout summary when offered the swap.

price.description: The UUID of the price to swap from.

swap_price.description: The UUID of the price to swap to.

archived_at.description: Time at which the object was archived. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

price.description: The associated price to swap from.

swap_price.description: The associated price to swap to.

number_type.description: The type of tax ID number.

eu_vat_verified.description: Whether or not this a verified EU VAT number based on regex validation and an attempted VIES check.

shipping.description: Whether or not this tax override applies to shipping.

rate.description: The tax rate to use for this tax override.

product_collection.description: The UUID of the product collection. (Not required if `shipping=true`.)

tax_zone.description: The UUID of the tax zone.

ca_tax_enabled.description: If set to `true` GST taxes will be calculated for all Canadian provinces.

default_rate.description: The default tax rate to use for checkouts when a specific `tax_registration` is not found. This will only apply if `default_tax_enabled=true`.

default_tax_enabled.description: Whether or not to use the `default_rate` when a specific `tax_registration` is not found.

eu_micro_exemption_enabled.description: If set to `true` VAT taxes will be calculated using the account's home country VAT rate.

eu_tax_enabled.description: If set to `true` VAT taxes will be calculated for all EU countries.

tax_behavior.description: Determines how taxes will be calculated. One of `exclusive` or `inclusive`.

tax_enabled.description: If set to `true` taxes will be automatically calculated.

eu_vat_required.description: Whether or not an `eu_vat` tax identifier is required when a customer's address is in the EU.

eu_vat_unverified_behavior.description: Determines how `eu_vat` tax identifiers will be handled when they are not verified against VIES. One of `apply_reverse_charge`, `error`, or `skip_reverse_charge`.

eu_vat_local_reverse_charge.description: Whether or not reverse charge should be applied when the customer's address is in the same country as the tax protocol address.

address.description: The associated address used for tax calculations

ca_tax_identifier.description: The tax identifier to be used for all Canadian provinces.

eu_tax_identifier.description: The tax identifier to be used for all EU countries.

address.description: The associated address used for tax calculations.

label.description: The tax label for this tax registration. If blank, the default tax label from the tax zone will be used.

manual_rate.description: The manual tax rate to use for this tax registration.

tax_identifier.description: The tax identifier to set for this tax registration.

tax_zone.description: The UUID of the tax zone.

default_rate.description: The default tax rate for the tax zone.

default_label.description: The label used to describe the default tax rate.

manual.description: Whether or not tax registrations for this zone require a `manual_rate`.

region.description: The tax region this zone is in.

number.description: The tracking number provided by the courier.

url.description: The URL to track this shipment on the courier's website. (This is inferred from the tracking number for some couriers.)

courier_name.description: The name of the courier for this shipment. (This is inferred from the tracking number for some couriers.)

amount_off.description: Amount (in the `currency` of the price) that will be taken off line items associated with this upsell.

duplicate_purchase_behavior.description: How to handle duplicate purchases of the product â€“ can be one of `allow`, `block_within_checkout`, or `block`.

fee_description.description: The description for this upsell which will be visible to customers.

percent_off.description: Percent that will be taken off line items associated with this upsell.

replacement_behavior.description:
Whether or not to replace line items in the associated checkout. Replacement occurs when a line item is upsold. Possible values include:
- `none` (default): No line items will be replaced.
- `all`: All line items will be replaced.

step.description: Where this upsell falls in position within the upsell funnel â€“ can be one of `initial`, `accepted`, or `declined`.

upsell_funnel.description: The UUID of the upsell funnel.

archived.description: Whether or not this upsell funnel is archived.

enabled.description: Whether or not this upsell funnel is enabled.

filter_match_type.description: The matching strategy to use when filtering upsell funnels â€“ can be `null` or one of `all`, `any`, `none`. If `null`, the upsell funnel will not be filtered and will be applicable to all checkouts.

filter_price_ids.description: The prices to filter this upsell funnel by.

filter_product_ids.description: The products to filter this upsell funnel by.

name.description: A name for this upsell that will be visible to customers.

priority.description: The priority of this upsell in relation to other upsells. Must be in the range of `1` - `5` with `5` being the highest priority and `1` being the lowest.

archived_at.description: Time at which the object was archived. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

email.description: The email address of the user.

first_name.description: The first name of the user.

last_name.description: The last name of the user.

amount.description: The amount in cents to be charged, represented as a whole integer for this specific integer. If empty, the regular `Price` amount will be used. If the `Product` has multiple prices, then this amount will be ignored and the selected `Price` amount will be used.

allow_out_of_stock_purchases.description: Whether or not to allow purchases of this variant when stock runs out. If true, the stock levels for this variant can go below zero. If `null`, inherits from the product.

auto_fulfill_enabled.description: Whether or not this variant should be auto fulfilled when it is purchased. This can only be `true` when `shipping_enabled` is `false`. If `null`, inherits from the product.

license_activation_limit.description: The max number of activations allowed per license. If `null`, inherits from the product or price.

option_1.description: The value for the first variant option.

option_2.description: The value for the second variant option.

option_3.description: The value for the third variant option.

position.description: The ordering position of this variant when displayed to customers.

purchase_limit.description: The max number of times this variant can be purchased by a customer. If `null`, inherits from the product.

shipping_enabled.description: If set to `true` checkouts with this variant will require a full shipping address. If `null`, inherits from the product.

sku.description: The stock keeping unit for this variant.

stock_enabled.description: Whether or not stock will be tracked for this variant. If `null`, inherits from the product.

tax_category.description: The tax category/code that matches this variant. If `null`, inherits from the product.

tax_enabled.description: If set to `true`, this variant is considered taxable. If `null`, inherits from the product.

weight.description: The variant weight, meant to be displayable to the customer. If `null`, inherits from the product.

weight_unit.description: The weight unit for this variant. If `null`, inherits from the product.

stock_adjustment.description: The amount to adjust the stock by. This can be a positive or negative number.

available_stock.description: The total amount of stock available for purchase. This is the total `stock` on hand minus `held_stock`.

currency.description: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. This is inherited from the price.

current_version.description: Whether or not this object represents the current version of this variant. (This will be `false` if the association was created to this variant before it was altered. In this case, we will lookup the version of the variant at the time it was associated.)

g_weight.description: The weight of this variant in grams. If `null`, inherits from the product.

held_stock.description: The total amount of stock being held by unfulfilled line items.

option_names.description: An array of the associated product's variant option names.

stock.description: The total amount of stock on hand for this product.

display_type.description: The display type of the variant option â€“ one of "radio" or "dropdown".

name.description: The variant option's name â€“ i.e. Size, Color, etc.

position.description: The ordering position of this variant option when displayed to customers.

values.description: A list of values for this variant option. (These are inferred from the values set on variants.)

email.description: The email to send the verification code to.

code.description: The code that was sent to the email.

email.description: The email the verification code was sent to.
The email the verification code was sent to.

verified.description: Whether or not this verification code has been verified.

verified_at.description: Date when the verification code was verified.

description.description: An optional description of what this webhook endpoint is used for.

enabled.description: Whether or not this webhook endpoint is active.

url.description: The URL of this webhook endpoint.

webhook_events.description: The webhook events that this webhook endpoint should send webhooks for. For example, if `webhook_events=["order.created"]` then the webhook endpoint will only send webhooks when the `order.created` event occurs.

automation_service.description: The automation service that this webhook endpoint is pointed at. One of `suretriggers` or `zapier`.

erroring_grace_period_ends_at.description: The time at which this webhook endpoint will be disabled if it continues to error.

erroring_grace_period_started_at.description: The time at which this webhook endpoint started erroring. A webhook endpoint is considered to be erroring when it returns a non 2xx response code. After 3 days, with 40% or more of requests erroring, the webhook endpoint will be disabled.

signing_secret.description: The webhook endpointâ€™s signing secret, used to generate webhook signatures.

tags.name: Abandonded Checkouts
tags.description:
An abandonded checkout represents a customer's most recent incomplete checkout.
When a checkout is associated with a customer and is left unpaid for 30 minutes a corresponding abandoned checkout is created. Only one abandoned checkout will be created per customer every 10 days.

tags.name: Abandoned Checkout Protocols
tags.description: An abandoned checkout protocol represents the abandoned checkout settings for an account.

tags.name: Accounts
tags.description: This is an object representing a SureCart account. You can retrieve it to see properties on the account like it's current - name or default currency.

tags.name: Activations
tags.description: An activation represents a single use of a license.

tags.name: Affiliation Products
tags.description: An affiliation product allows for setting a specific commission structure for a product and affiliation.

tags.name: Affiliation Protocols
tags.description: An affiliation protocol represents the affiliate settings for an account.

tags.name: Affiliation Requests
tags.description: An affiliation request represents a request from an affiliate to join an account's affiliate program.

tags.name: Affiliations
tags.description: An affiliation represents a relationship between an affiliate and an account.

tags.name: Balance Transactions
tags.description: You may modify a customer's balance by creating a balance transaction, which increments or decrements the customer's balance by the specified amount.

tags.name: Balances
tags.description: Each customer has a balance value for each currency, which denotes a debit or credit that's automatically applied to their next invoice upon finalizing.

tags.name: Brands
tags.description: A brand represents the design and branding settings for an account.

tags.name: Bulk Actions
tags.description: A bulk action is a way to perform a single action on multiple resources at once.

tags.name: Bumps
tags.description: A bump represents a price that will be conditionally recommended to customers during checkout. Bumps are displayed below the checkout summary and offer an easy way to add additional products to the checkout. They are a more powerful alternative to swaps, but they are more intrusive to the checkout experience.

tags.name: Cancellation Acts
tags.description: A cancellation act represents a customer attempt to cancel a subscription.

tags.name: Cancellation Reasons
tags.description: Cancellation reasons are specific reasons that a customer can select from when cancelling a subscription.

tags.name: Charges
tags.description: A Charge represents a credit or debit card transaction that was captured through one of your processors. Only succesfully captured charges are recorded in SureCart.

tags.name: Checkouts
tags.description: A checkout represents a collection of one-time and/or subscription products that a customer intends to purchase.

tags.name: Checkout Portal Protocols
tags.description: A checkout portal protocol represents the checkout portal settings for an account.

tags.name: Clicks
tags.description: A click is a record of a customer clicking on an affiliate link. Click records are associated with checkouts to create referrals.

tags.name: Coupons
tags.description:
A coupon contains information about a percent-off or amount-off discount.
The coupon object can be used to discount either one-time payments or subscriptions. There are some additional parameters that apply to subscriptions, but are not applicable to one-time payments, such as duration. Regardless of what duration is set to, it only applies once for one-time payments.

tags.name: Customer Links
tags.description:
Customer links are temporary objects that allow access to customers through email lookup.
Each customer link is valid for the greater of 1 hour after it's `created_at` time or 1 hour after it's `first_used_at` time. This means that if a customer link is not used within the first hour it expires. If a customer link is used within the first hour then it is valid for another hour starting from the time it was first used. So, a customer link that is used 30min after it's created will be valid for a total of 1hr 30min.

tags.name: Customer Notification Protocols
tags.description: A customer notification protocol represents the customer notification settings for an account.

tags.name: Customers
tags.description: Customer objects allow you to perform recurring charges, and to track multiple charges, that are associated with the same customer.

tags.name: Customer Portal Protocols
tags.description: A customer portal protocol represents the customer portal settings for an account.

tags.name: Display Currencies
tags.description: Display currencies are the currencies that are available to customers from the currency selector on your store.

tags.name: Downloads
tags.description: Downloads represent the medias that can be downloaded when a specific product is purchased.

tags.name: Events
tags.description: Events are our way of letting you know when something interesting happens in your account. When an interesting event occurs, we create a new `Event` object. For example, when a subscription updates, we create a `subscription.updated` event.

tags.name: Exports
tags.description: Exports allow you to download your raw data from your SureCart account.

tags.name: Fees
tags.description: A fee represents an additional amount added or subtracted from a specific line item.

tags.name: Fulfillment Items
tags.description: A fulfillment item represents a specific line item being shipped to a customer within a fulfillment.

tags.name: Fulfillments
tags.description: A fulfillment represents a shipment of products within an order to a customer.

tags.name: Imports
tags.description: Imports allow you to upload raw data into your SureCart account to batch create customers, products, subscriptions, etc.

tags.name: Invoices
tags.description: Invoices are statements of amounts owed by a customer. They wrap a checkout and can be configured to collect payment automatically or be sent to the customer for payment.

tags.name: Licenses
tags.description: A license represents permission for a customer to use a specific product. Each license has an auto-generated `key` which can be used with the public license endpoints.

tags.name: Line Items
tags.description: A line item represents a price and it's quantity being purchased by a customer within a checkout.

tags.name: Manual Charges
tags.description: A manual charge represents record of a payment that was captured outside of SureCart.

tags.name: Manual Payment Methods
tags.description: Manual payment methods are used to allow customers to checkout with manual approval â€“ i.e. cash on delivery, bank transfers, etc.

tags.name: Medias
tags.description: Medias represent files that are hosted on our servers. Medias are uploaded directly to the underlying hosting service. To learn more about how medias work, please contact support.

tags.name: Notes
tags.description: Notes are snippets of text that can be attached to objects to provide extra context. Notes can be added to `Customer`, `Order`, and `Subscription` objects.

tags.name: Order Protocols
tags.description: A order protocol represents the order settings for an account.

tags.name: Orders
tags.description: An order is a customer's completed request to purchase one or more products. An order is created when a checkout is paid.

tags.name: Payment Failures
tags.description: A payment failure represents an attempt to pay a checkout that failed.

tags.name: Payment Intents
tags.description: A payment intent represents the process of collecting a payment method from your customer.

tags.name: Payment Methods
tags.description: Payment method objects represent your customer's payment instruments.

tags.name: Payout Groups
tags.description: A payout group represents a group of payouts that are created together.

tags.name: Payouts
tags.description: A payout represents a payment to an affiliate.

tags.name: Periods
tags.description: A period represents a billing interval for a subscription.

tags.name: Prices
tags.description:
Prices define the unit cost, currency, and (optional) billing cycle for both recurring and one-time purchases of products. Products help you track inventory or provisioning, and prices help you track payment terms. Different physical goods or levels of service should be represented by products, and pricing options should be represented by prices.
This approach lets you change prices without having to change your provisioning scheme. For example, you might have a single \"gold\" product that has prices for $10/month, $100/year, and â‚¬9 once.

tags.name: Processors
tags.description: A processor represents a connection to a third-party payment processor like Stripe.

tags.name: Product Collections
tags.description: A list of related products - used to categorize products.

tags.name: Product Groups
tags.description: A group of related products â€“ used to configure which products a customer can switch between when updating a subscription.

tags.name: Product Medias
tags.description: Product medias represent a product's images.

tags.name: Products
tags.description: Products describe the specific goods or services you offer to your customers. For example, you might offer a Standard and Premium version of your goods or service; each version would be a separate Product. They can be used in conjunction with Prices to configure pricing and Subscriptions.

tags.name: Promotions
tags.description: A Promotion represents a customer-redeemable code for a coupon. It can be used to create multiple codes for a single coupon.

tags.name: Purchases
tags.description: A purchase represents a specific product that a customer has paid for (one-time products), or is currently paying for (recurring products via a subscription). The purchase model is a summary of all products that a customer current should have "access" to.

tags.name: Referral Items
tags.description: A referral item represents a specific line item within a referral.

tags.name: Referrals
tags.description: A referral represents a checkout that is associated with an affiliate.

tags.name: Refunds
tags.description: Refund objects allow you to refund a charge that has previously been created but not yet refunded. Funds will be refunded to the credit or debit card that was originally charged.

tags.name: Return Items
tags.description: A return item represents a specific line item being returned from a customer within a return request.

tags.name: Return Requests
tags.description: A return request represents a return of products within an order from a customer.

tags.name: Reviews
tags.description: A review represents a customer's review of a product.

tags.name: Review Medias
tags.description: Review medias represent the media that is associated with a review.

tags.name: Review Protocols
tags.description: A review protocol represents the review settings for an account.

tags.name: Shipping Methods
tags.description: Shipping methods represent the different speeds/classes of shipping that a store offers â€“ i.e. `Express`, `Ground`, etc.

tags.name: Shipping Profiles
tags.description: A shipping profile is a grouping of products that have the same shipping zones and rates. Each product can belong to one shipping profile.

tags.name: Shipping Protocols
tags.description: A shipping protocol represents the shipping settings for an account.

tags.name: Shipping Rates
tags.description: Shipping rates represent the specific rules for determining the cost of shipping based on the products within a checkout.

tags.name: Shipping Zones
tags.description: A shipping zone represents a geographical (group of countries) boundary for setting specific shipping rates within a shipping profile.

tags.name: Statistics
tags.description: A group of endpoints that provide high level statistics on resources.

tags.name: Subscription Protocols
tags.description: A subscription protocol represents the subscription settings for an account.

tags.name: Subscriptions
tags.description: A Subscription represents a recurring schedule to charge a customer on one of your processors.

tags.name: Swaps
tags.description: A swap represents a price that will be conditionally recommended to customers during checkout. Swaps are displayed in the checkout summary and can be easily toggled on or off. They are non-intrusive alternative to bumps, and offer customers an easy way to flip between two prices.

tags.name: Tax Overrides
tags.description: A tax override is a manual tax rate that will be applied to products in a collection or shipping within a specific tax zone.

tags.name: Tax Protocols
tags.description: A tax protocol represents the tax settings for an account.

tags.name: Tax Registrations
tags.description: A tax registration represents a tax zone that is enabled for an account. Taxes will not be calculated for checkouts within a tax zone unless a matching tax registration exists.

tags.name: Tax Zones
tags.description: A tax zone represents a geographic area (country and state combinations) that taxes can be calculated for.

tags.name: Trackings
tags.description: A tracking represents the tracking number information from a shipping courier.

tags.name: Upsell Funnels
tags.description: An upsell funnel represents a group of upsells that will be presented to customers after checkout in a specific order.

tags.name: Upsells
tags.description: An upsell represents a price (maybe discounted) that will be offered to customers after checkout.

tags.name: Variant Options
tags.description: Variant options represent the custom properties of a product â€“ i.e. `Size`, `Color`, etc.

tags.name: Variant Values
tags.description: Variant values represent the custom values of a specific variant option. For example, a variant option named `Color` could have variant values of `Red` and `Blue`.

tags.name: Variants
tags.description: A variant represents one version of a product with several options. Each product can have a maximum of three variant options and a maximum of 100 variants.

tags.name: Verification Codes
tags.description:
Verification codes are short-lived authentication codes that can be used to verify access to an email address. They provide a secure way of granting access to the customer portal without requiring the customer to have a password.
Each verification code is valid for 10 minutes, and you are limited to creating 1 every minute per email address.

tags.name: Webhook Endpoints
tags.description:
You can configure webhook endpoints via the API to be notified about events that happen in your SureCart account.
Most users configure webhooks from the dashboard, which provides a user interface for registering and testing your webhook endpoints.

parameters.description: The URL the customer will be redirected to after the payment process. This is only applicable for `mollie` processors.

patch.description: Finalizes a specific checkout before it can be paid. If succesfull, this will return an associated `PaymentIntent` with the necessary information to capture the payment via the specific processor.
Manually marks a checkout as paid. This can only be performed on checkouts that have been finalized. When a checkout is paid associated purchases and subscriptions will be created.

Cancels a specific checkout. This action can only be performed on checkouts that are `paid` or `processing`. When a checkout is canceled associated purchases will be revoked and subscriptions will be canceled.
Records an offer for the specific bump â€“ used for bump analytics.
Records an offer for the specific upsell â€“ used for upsell analytics.
Records a decline for the specific upsell â€“ used for upsell analytics and to traverse through an upsell funnel by refreshing the `current_upsell`.
